title: Sreevaraham Vanitha Samithi

detailsOfAchievement: Sreevaraham Vanitha Samithi registered on 8th January 1957 under Charitable Endowment Act was founded earlier as â€˜Balika Samajamâ€™ in the year 1913 and later started functioning under a duly constituted Board during 1954. Aim of Samithi is comprehensive progress of women and children unfolding the problems pertaining to social, economic, health, educational and in the cultural spheres. Ponnamma Thanu Pillai Charitable Trust is formed with Reg No. 545/82 on 20-10-1982. Samithi by its activities later developed into one of the best women empowerment programme implementing Centres in the State. Apart from health related activities, pre-school education since 1954, craft oriented training programmes , Family planning activities, â€˜Aâ€™ class Women and Childrenâ€™s library since 1964, Radio assembling ancillary to Keltron, health clinic for women and children, childrenâ€™s theatre since 1972 , childrenâ€™s park and play ground, Childrenâ€™s museum, dance and music classes, research/training section for studies, seminars, training programmes, pre-primary teachers training, rural extension centre etc. were the earlier activities of Samithi. Vayojanamitram, a day care centre for elderly women aided by Help Age India was functioning here. Studies undertaken â€“ A case study of ancillary unit â€“ Keltron, literary survey of slum colony of Trivandrum, study of street children by UNICEF through IMG, female child in Kerala-acceptance in family, preparation of catalogues of agencies reaching the poorest women of India â€“ for Institute of Social Studies Trust, New Delhi- A CIDA Project, Trivandrum experiment, an ILO sponsored study on TRYSEM, Socio economic programmes for women under Social Welfare Board, and a resource centre for womenâ€™s studies and programs, and a guidance wing attached to it. Present activities Samithi works for the overall welfare of women and children. Activities in the area of health awareness through socio economic programmes aimed at the empowerment of women by Seminars/ Conferences are regularly conducted. Ponnamma Thanu Pillai, CBSE school started in the year 1999 with classes from play school to Std IV. Free education is given to 40-50 children every year out of the total of 175. Women and childrenâ€™s library is affiliated to Kerala State Library Council. Balavedi, Vanitha Vedi and Moving Library are part of Library activities. Skill training programmes like book binding, sewing machine mechanism, fabric painting, mural painting, bag making, soft toy making, metal embossing, soap, detergent and lotion making, Christmas/wedding decorations, thermal cooker making, bead works, wall hangings, cutting tailoring, hand embroidery, computer classes, communicative English, Yoga classes, handicraft work etc are conducted. Awareness programmes for adolescents and women on health, violence against women, waste management, water preservation, legal awareness, energy conservation, use of solar devices, gender sensitization, food preservation, cookery classes are regular activities. Health camps for women, children and public, ayurveda massage, home nursing classes, life skill education for adolescent girls, importance of human values, education and Personality Development classes are conducted. Summer camps conducted for children every year. Programmes conducted mostly with the aid of Central / State Governments, NABARD, MSME, KSUDP, AIWC, JSS, District Industries Centre, IOB, Canara Bank, Food and Nutrtion Board, Swadeshi Grama Vikasana Kendra etc.

detailsOfAchievement: The trust has been doing charitable activities since last 10 years specially concentrating on eye care. The trust conducts free eye camps in remote areas and villages, examine people, identify the eye problems and do surgical procedures either free or at concessional rates without any profit motive where necessary. On an average 550-600 cataract surgeries are done in a year totally free of cost. Aim of the trust is to reduce the burden of preventable and curable blindness.

detailsOfAchievement: Two acres of land has been purchased for running the activities of the trust using own fund. This organization has been initiated with the aim of helping the vulnerable sections of the society especially women, children and the indigenous population. The activities so far implemented by the organization include educational assistance to children belonging to poor families, medical help for rural and tribal people, financial assistance to the widows & elderly population, technical and financial assistance to the farmers, housing grants to the most deserving families and so on. The trust used to provide such assistance ever since its inception and in the last year 22 students belonging to the poor families, 30 critically ill patients and 5 farmers were given financial assistance. In addition house maintenance grant has been provided to four economically weaker families in the last year. With the aim of enabling the poor rural women and men for income generation a stitching unit has been started in Kovilkadavu Periyavayal in Kanthalloor Panchayat in the last year. The unit is presently functioning in a rented building. The expenditure for starting the unit has been arranged by taking a loan of Rs 700000/- from the Agriculture Development Bank (Karsheeka Vikasana Bank) Marayoor.

detailsOfAchievement: Swadeshi Science Movement is (SSM) is a leading popular cum professional science organization in the state of Kerala dedicated for the cause of science. It envisions social development, cultural enhancement and environmental maintenance through the popularization of science, imbibing scientific advancements along with scientific heritage of the country. SSM has spread her wings into â€¢ Engineering and Technology (Bharadwaja Sarani), â€¢ Architecture (Vaasthuvidya Sarani), â€¢ Animal welfare and Rural development (AWARDS), â€¢ Centre for innovative and entrepreneurship development (CIED), â€¢ Agricultural development (Parasara Sarani), â€¢ Ayurveda (Vagbhata Sarani), â€¢ Studies in Yoga (Yogavidya Sarani) , â€¢ Mathematic Research and studies( Ramanuja Sarani), â€¢ Women empowerment (Sakthi), â€¢ Biodiversity conservation and Environment protection (Green Doctors & Swadeshi Environment Services(SES), â€¢ Science Research Institute (SRI) etc. â€¢ Art and Culture( Thyagaraja Sarani) â€¢ Publications Wing â€¢ Students Youth Programme â€¢ Nalanda virtual university SSM conducts Sastra Prathibha Matsaram in which ten thousand students take part. Delegates from all over the world participate in The World Ayurveda Congress. Sasthra Madhanam and Ashtanga Hridaya Sathram are conducted by Vagbhata Srani in which Ayurveda Doctors and students of BAMS from all over India participate. SSM conducts Science Congress every year, coinciding with the birthday of C. V. Raman in which scientists & technocrats as well as local people participate and share their knowledge. Scientific papers are presented in regional language also. Arya Bhateeyam is yet another popular science programme. SSM celebrates National technology Day, National Science Day, Self Reliance Day etc. Several workshops, seminars public meetings, action programme etc are conducted by SSM every year, to spread the scientific knowledge to the nook and corner of the society. There are programme for science communication through digital media, folk media and regional languages. SSM gives thrust to rural developmental activities and promotion of rural technologies. SSM train youth and women to empower them and be self reliant. SSM gives opportunities to the rural population to exhibit their products and innovative ideas. For the dedicated effort in science popularization and rural development, Swadeshi Science Movement has been awarded with the prestigious â€œNational Award for Outstanding Efforts in Science and Technology Communicationâ€ by the NCSTC, Department of Science and Technology, Govt. of India for the year 2006 and was accredited with the â€œJAWAHARLAL NEHRU PRIZEâ€ for science popularization by the Indian Science Congress Association in 2005-06.

detailsOfAchievement: The Angadikadavu Don Bosco Society was started in the year of 1994 in the very remote area called Angadikadavu, in Kannur District. The Society is managed by Salesians of Don Bosco(SDB) and delivers quality education and other social services to the rural people.The society initially focused on starting educational institutions and presently society runs two professional colleges in the area. the Professional College is names as Don Bosco College, Angadikadave, which is approved by AICTE and affiliated to Kannur University. It provides the Master degree in Computer Application. The Other College names as Don Bosco Arts and Science College,Angadikadavu, which delivers Arts and Science- bachelors and Masters Degrees which includes Social work,Journalism, literature, Commerce, Mathematics etc. As part of delivering Social Service to the Community, society initiated its Professional Service Wing named Don Bosco Initiatives for Social Action (DISA) in Collaboration with Social Work Department. Under this, Society initiated different schemes and programmed. Don Bosco, angadikadavu is the Nodel Organisation of Childline, Kannur. DISA also initiated DIDA Legal Aid Clinic, in Collaboration with District Legal Service Authority, Kannur. Society also runs different Projects and Programmes underDISA in the areas of Research and Development, Training and Consultancy, Youth Development, Family and Child Welfare, Legal Aid and Services, Women Empowerment, Elder Care, Counselling and Mentoring etc.
